title: Reason why Vieira chose this version of the story

content.question: Vieira’s assertion that Solomon and the Queen of Sheba had a son diverges from the traditional Hebrew account. Which of the following best explains Vieira’s choice to tell this version of the story?

choices.label: By the seventeenth century, scholars had more information about the events discussed by Vieira.
Vieira wished to tailor his sermon to appeal to Brazil’s ethnically and racially diverse population.
Vieira was influenced by Jesuit anti-Semitism and wished to undermine the Hebrew account.
Vieira was attempting to encourage intermarriage between Brazilians of African and European descent.

content.answer: Vieira wished to tailor his sermon to appeal to Brazil’s ethnically and racially diverse population.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain the point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience of a source.
